refnamediv.refpurpose: A base class for menu objects

refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Signals
refsect1.synopsis: "activate-current" void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, gboolean force_hide, gpointer user_data) : Run last / Action "cancel" void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, gpointer user_data) : Run last / Action "cycle-focus" void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, GtkDirectionType *arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run last / Action "deactivate" void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, gpointer user_data) : Run first "move-current" void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, GtkMenuDirectionType direction, gpointer user_data) : Run last / Action "selection-done" void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, gpointer user_data) : Run first

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A GtkMenuShell is the abstract base class used to derive the GtkMenu and GtkMenuBar subclasses.

A GtkMenuShell is a container of GtkMenuItem objects arranged in a list which can be navigated, selected, and activated by the user to perform application functions. A GtkMenuItem can have a submenu associated with it, allowing for nested hierarchical menus.

refsect2.title: GtkMenuShell
refsect2.para:
The GtkMenuShell-struct struct contains the following fields. (These fields should be considered read-only. They should never be set by an application.)
GList *children; The list of GtkMenuItem objects contained by this GtkMenuShell.

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_append ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new GtkMenuItem to the end of the menu shell's item list.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell.
The GtkMenuItem to add.

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_prepend ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new GtkMenuItem to the beginning of the menu shell's item list.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell.
The GtkMenuItem to add.

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_insert ()
refsect2.para: Adds a new GtkMenuItem to the menu shell's item list at the position indicated by position.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell.
The GtkMenuItem to add.
The position in the item list where child is added. Positions are numbered from 0 to n-1.

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_deactivate ()
refsect2.para: Deactivates the menu shell. Typically this results in the menu shell being erased from the screen.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell.

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_select_item ()
refsect2.para: Selects the menu item from the menu shell.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell.
The GtkMenuItem to select.

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_select_first ()

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell
if TRUE, search for the first selectable menu item, otherwise select nothing if the first item isn't sensitive. This should be FALSE if the menu is being popped up initially.

refsect2.para: Since 2.2

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_deselect ()
refsect2.para: Deselects the currently selected item from the menu shell, if any.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell.

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_activate_item ()
refsect2.para: Activates the menu item within the menu shell.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell.
The GtkMenuItem to activate.
If TRUE, force the deactivation of the menu shell after the menu item is activated.

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_cancel ()
refsect2.para: Cancels the selection within the menu shell.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell

refsect2.para: Since 2.4

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_set_take_focus ()
refsect2.para: If take_focus is TRUE (the default) the menu shell will take the keyboard focus so that it will receive all keyboard events which is needed to enable keyboard navigation in menus.
Setting take_focus to FALSE is useful only for special applications like virtual keyboard implementations which should not take keyboard focus.

The take_focus state of a menu or menu bar is automatically propagated to submenus whenever a submenu is popped up, so you don't have to worry about recursively setting it for your entire menu hierarchy. Only when programmatically picking a submenu and popping it up manually, the take_focus property of the submenu needs to be set explicitely.
Note that setting it to FALSE has side-effects:

If the focus is in some other app, it keeps the focus and keynav in the menu doesn't work. Consequently, keynav on the menu will only work if the focus is on some toplevel owned by the onscreen keyboard.
To avoid confusing the user, menus with take_focus set to FALSE should not display mnemonics or accelerators, since it cannot be guaranteed that they will work.
See also gdk_keyboard_grab()

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell
TRUE if the menu shell should take the keyboard focus on popup.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8

refsect2.title: gtk_menu_shell_get_take_focus ()
refsect2.para: Returns TRUE if the menu shell will take the keyboard focus on popup.

listitem.simpara: a GtkMenuShell
TRUE if the menu shell will take the keyboard focus on popup.

refsect2.para: Since 2.8

refsect2.title: enum GtkMenuDirectionType
refsect2.para:
An enumeration representing directional movements within a menu.
GTK_MENU_DIR_PARENT To the parent menu shell.
GTK_MENU_DIR_CHILD To the submenu, if any, associated with the item.
GTK_MENU_DIR_NEXT To the next menu item.
GTK_MENU_DIR_PREV To the previous menu item.

refsect2.title: The "take-focus" property
refsect2.para: A boolean that determines whether the menu and its submenus grab the keyboard focus. See gtk_menu_shell_set_take_focus() and gtk_menu_shell_get_take_focus().
Default value: TRUE
Since 2.8

refsect2.title: The "activate-current" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, gboolean force_hide, gpointer user_data) : Run last / Action
refsect2.para: An action signal that activates the current menu item within the menu shell.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
if TRUE, hide the menu after activating the menu item.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "cancel" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, gpointer user_data) : Run last / Action
refsect2.para: An action signal which cancels the selection within the menu shell. Causes the GtkMenuShell::selection-done signal to be emitted.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "cycle-focus" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, GtkDirectionType *arg1, gpointer user_data) : Run last / Action

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "deactivate" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, gpointer user_data) : Run first
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when a menu shell is deactivated.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "move-current" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, GtkMenuDirectionType direction, gpointer user_data) : Run last / Action
refsect2.para: An action signal which moves the current menu item in the direction specified by direction.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
the direction to move.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.

refsect2.title: The "selection-done" signal
refsect2.programlisting: void user_function (GtkMenuShell *menushell, gpointer user_data) : Run first
refsect2.para: This signal is emitted when a selection has been completed within a menu shell.

listitem.simpara: the object which received the signal.
user data set when the signal handler was connected.
